item.title: How To Uninstall Ubuntu Touch And Restore Android
item.description:
Hi! Today I would like to share a small cheat sheet on how to unistall Ubuntu Touch and restore Android on your smartphone.

Firstly, find and download a proper Android build from here. In my case it was occam-lmy48t-factory-c43c7cfd.zip since my smarphone is Nexus 4.

Secondly, make sure you …
item.dc:creator: Aleksander Alekseev

item.title: It Seems That My First Quadcopter Is Ready
item.description:
OK, it looks like I've finished assembling and configuring my first quadcopter. At least, it takes off the floor and seems to do it smoothly (finally!). Here is a short video:

Now I only have to wait for appropriate weather. Currently in Moscow it's about -2 C (29 F) and …
item.dc:creator: Aleksander Alekseev

item.title: TLS: Not Actually Secure?
item.description:
Here is a little observation I would like to share.

Chromium says that the connection to my blog is secure. However, what does "secure" mean? For instance, can someone conduct a MITM attack - intercept cookies or modify pages content? Well, TLS should guard against such attacks. In theory.

In practice …
item.dc:creator: Aleksander Alekseev

item.title: PGConf.us 2017 "In-core Compression" Talk Slides
item.description:
On PGConf.us 2017 Anastasia Lubennikova and I presented a talk "In-core compression: how to shrink your database size in several times". The slides for this talk are now available on SlideShare:

Here is a short description of the talk:
